arguments.argument: Some drag performances contain explicit content that is not appropriate for children.
Public events should ensure performances align with community standards.
Parents should have control over what their children are exposed to in public.
Drag performances in certain venues may not be suitable for all audiences.
Some argue that drag performances could promote gender ideology to minors.
Regulating public performances ensures they are appropriate for all viewers.
Public spaces should remain neutral and avoid controversial performances.
Certain forms of drag performance may blur the lines between entertainment and activism.
Protecting community values should take precedence over unrestricted performances.
Not all drag performances are offensive, but some regulations are necessary.
Restricting drag performances violates free speech and artistic expression.
Drag is a legitimate form of entertainment and self-expression.
Targeting drag performances could lead to broader censorship of other art forms.
Not all drag performances contain adult themes or inappropriate content.
Parents can decide whether their children attend drag events.
There is no legal basis for restricting drag performances differently from other performances.
Laws regulating public performances should apply equally to all entertainment forms.
Drag culture is part of LGBTQ+ identity and should be protected.
Banning drag performances could encourage discrimination against LGBTQ+ individuals.
People who oppose drag performances can simply choose not to attend them.
